translations.The received state does not match the ex: The received state does not match the expected value.
translations.Failed to decrypt the ID4ME provider cli: Failed to decrypt the ID4ME provider client secret
translations.The audience does not match ours: The audience does not match ours
translations.The authorized party does not match ours: The authorised party does not match ours
translations.You must access Nextcloud with HTTPS to: You must access Nextcloud with HTTPS to use OpenID Connect.
translations.There is no such OpenID Connect provider: There is no such OpenID Connect provider.
translations.Could not reach the OpenID Connect provi: Could not reach the OpenID Connect provider.
translations.The identity provider failed to authenti: The identity provider failed to authenticate the user.
translations.Failed to decrypt the OIDC provider clie: Failed to decrypt the OIDC provider client secret
translations.Failed to contact the OIDC provider toke: Failed to contact the OIDC provider token endpoint
translations.The issuer does not match the one from t: The issuer does not match the one from the discovery endpoint
translations.You do not have permission to log in to: You do not have permission to log in to this instance. If you think this is an error, please contact an administrator.
translations.Use an OpenID Connect backend to login t: Use an OpenID Connect backend to login to your Nextcloud
translations.Allows flexible configuration of an OIDC: Allows flexible configuration of an OIDC server as Nextcloud login user backend.
translations.Are you sure you want to delete the prov: Are you sure you want to delete the provider "{providerName}"?
translations.Allows users to authenticate via OpenID: Allows users to authenticate via OpenID Connect providers.
translations.\"Store login tokens\" is needed if you: "Store login tokens" is needed if you are using other apps that want to use user_oidc's token exchange or simply get the login token
translations.Configure your provider to redirect back: Configure your provider to redirect back to {url}
translations.Redirect URI (to be authorized in the pr: Redirect URI (to be authorized in the provider client configuration)
translations.Display name to identify the provider: Display name to identify the provider
translations.Warning, if the protocol of the URLs in: Warning, if the protocol of the URLs in the discovery content is HTTP, the ID token will be delivered through an insecure connection.
translations.Enable nested and fallback claim mapping: Enable nested and fallback claim mappings (like "{example}")
translations.By default every user will get a unique: By default every user will get a unique user ID that is a hashed value of the provider and user ID. This can be turned off but uniqueness of users accross multiple user backends and providers is no longer preserved then.
translations.Use provider identifier as prefix for ID: Use provider identifier as prefix for IDs
translations.To keep IDs in plain text, but also pres: To keep IDs in plain text, but also preserve uniqueness of them across multiple providers, a prefix with the providers name is added.
translations.Restrict login for users that are not in: Restrict login for users that are not in any whitelisted group
translations.Users that are not part of any whitelist: Users that are not part of any whitelisted group are not created and can not login
translations.Check Bearer token on API and WebDAV req: Check Bearer token on API and WebDAV requests
translations.Do you want to allow API calls and WebDA: Do you want to allow API calls and WebDAV requests that are authenticated with an OIDC ID token or access token?
translations.Auto provision user when accessing API a: Auto provision user when accessing API and WebDAV with Bearer token
translations.This automatically provisions the user,: This automatically provisions the user, when sending API and WebDAV requests with a Bearer token. Auto provisioning and Bearer token check have to be activated for this to work.
translations.Send ID token hint on logout: Send ID token hint on logout
translations.Should the ID token be included as the i: Should the ID token be included as the id_token_hint GET parameter in the OpenID logout URL? Users are redirected to this URL after logging out of Nextcloud. Enabling this setting exposes the OIDC ID token to the user agent, which may not be necessary depending on the OIDC provider.
translations.Only groups matching the whitelist regex: Only groups matching the whitelist regex will be created, updated and deleted by the group claim. For example: {regex} allows all groups which ID starts with {substr}
translations.This will create and update the users gr: This will create and update the users groups depending on the groups claim in the ID token. The Format of the groups claim value should be {sample1}, {sample2} or {sample3}
